p: In different studies, several factors have been associated with the risk of chronification of musculoskeletal complaints. Factors to highlight include the following: being a female; being older than 45 years; severe pain, presence of edema, rigidity, or polyarthritis during the acute phase; previous joint disease; diabetes; high viral load; elevated levels of protein C in the acute phase; and persistently elevated immunoglobulin (Ig) M.
